content: The 'end of AI' refers to its complete integration into society, where it becomes so ubiquitous and seamless that it is no longer perceived as a separate intelligence.
AI reasoning has evolved through stages: chain-of-thought prompting, ReAct framework, knowledge graphs, multi-agent systems, hierarchical reasoning on graph manifolds, and hive minds.

Human society operates through meaning, narrative, interpretation, and ambiguity, while AI operates through optimization functions, probabilistic inference, and pattern matching, representing fundamentally incompatible logic systems.
Social fissures will emerge from the friction between the incompatible logic systems of human society and AI.

The 'specification class' is a technocratic elite (policymakers, data scientists, corporate strategists) who define AI reward functions, translating human goals into formal objective functions, thereby shaping societal behavior.
Society is becoming operationally dependent on the AI subsystem for stability, leading to critical functions becoming opaque to democratic oversight.
Human institutions will manage the social consequences of AI decisions without the ability to influence the underlying mechanics of the AI systems.
A new social fissure will emerge between the 'specification class' (who define AI behavior) and the 'systematically managed class' (whose lives are optimized by AI).

AI systems will shape information and opportunities, leading to hardened, sealed communities becoming a structural feature of society, effectively weaponizing filter bubbles into fundamental infrastructure.
AI will become completely integrated within society in the coming years, to the point where it is no longer noticed as a separate form of intelligence, marking 'the end of AI' by becoming invisible.
